conclusion: The problem involves maximizing the power source output efficiency using resistors \\( R_1 \\) and \\( R_2 \\).
The graph shows the terminal voltage \\( U \\) versus current \\( I \\) for the power source and resistors \\( R_1 \\) and \\( R_2 \\).
The internal resistance \\( r \\) of the power source is 1 ohm.
Using \\( R_1 \\) alone, the efficiency is 0.5.
Using \\( R_2 \\) alone, the efficiency is 0.75.
Using \\( R_1 \\) and \\( R_2 \\) in series, the efficiency is 0.8.
Using \\( R_1 \\) and \\( R_2 \\) in parallel, the efficiency is approximately 0.4286.
The highest efficiency is achieved when \\( R_1 \\) and \\( R_2 \\) are connected in series.
